result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey L. Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

180 days conditional jail time with work release.  Conditional time and probation to begin today, Jan. 13, 2016.

Defendant restricted from driving any motor vehicle, including boat, in the first two years of probation except for work, school, and religious activities or with permission of the agent.

Court costs and costs of supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release and 0 days credit.  Jail time to begin 1/13/16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey L. Shannon

defendant.name: Shannon, Jeffrey L.
defendant.address: 29115 County Highway E, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Court to def. re occupational license

Defendant Jeffrey L. Shannon in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together for sentencing:  15CF67 and 13CF59.  DA asks for probation on the felonies (Count 1 of 15CF67 and Count 2/DPA-revoked count of 13CF59) with 180 days conditional jail time, consecutive and conditions that def not be permitted to drive any mv (car, truck, boat, etc) in the 1st 2 years of probation except for work, school, or relig. reasons, unless allowed by agent.  Def has already been convicted of these counts.  PSI had been ordered and received.  Def now before the Court for sentencing on these 2 counts.

DA and Atty. McDougal each address the Court.

Court rules on the sentence:  

Count 1/15CF67 - 4 years probation with 180 days jail conditional time; costs; def restricted from driving m/v including boat in first 2 yrs except work, school, and relig. activities.
Count 2/13CF59 - same sentence with conditional time of 180 days, consecutive to 15CF57, and with same conditions.  Costs ordered on both cases.

Def presently on ATR but that doesn't apply, per DA.  Counsel ask that JOC specify probation and conditional jail both start today.  So ordered.
of Atty. M to the clerk - wanted to make sure the PSI order was also done for count 2 of this case; it was already done for 15CF67

Defendant Jeffrey L. Shannon in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  15CF67 for status and 13CF59 for motion hearing on State's motion to revoke DPA on count 2/2nd degree recklessly endangering safety.

DA states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of both matters.  

In 15CF67, Def waives his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy on waiver.  Information filed.  To  count 1/fleeing and eluding, Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  PSI requested and ordered - due by 1/4.  PSI writer to be present in person or by telephone.  Court directs PSI writer to distribute the PSI to all necessary parties.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

In 13CF59, DPA revoked on count 2.  

Sentencing in both matters set for 1/13 at 10 - 30 minutes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey L. Shannon in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA requests reset.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey L. Shannon in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Court states charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M states that the def waives prelim time limits.  DA states that def is presently subject to revocation of probation; additionally, State will be filing a motion to revoke def's DPA in 13CF59; that matter to be set at same time as next appearance in this case.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
